metadata.title: CVE-2022-48917 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:ASoC: ops: Shift tested values in snd_soc_put_volsw() by +minWhile the $val/$val2 values passed in from userspace are always >= 0integers, the limits of the control can be signed integers and the $mincan be non-zero and less than zero. To correctly validate $val/$val2against platform_max, add the $min offset to val first.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48917` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
